metadata.title: Convert Watts to BTU per Hour – Power Converter
metadata.description: Convert power output from Watts (W) to BTU per Hour (BTU/h), useful for understanding HVAC system ratings.

introduction: This converter transforms modern watt ratings to traditional BTU per hour, enabling HVAC system understanding.
Modern equipment specifies power in watts while traditional HVAC uses BTU/h.
This converter uses the relationship where 1 watt equals approximately 3.412 BTU/h.
methodology: 1 W ≈ 3.412 BTU/h. To convert watts to BTU/h, multiply by 3.412.
Understanding watt to BTU/h conversion helps evaluate heating and cooling system capacity.
HVAC professionals use both units; conversion enables clear communication.
This converter provides accurate power conversion for heating/cooling planning.
examples: Example 2 – Standard air conditioner: 2,000 watts ≈ 6,824 BTU/h.
Example 3 – Large HVAC system: 5,000 watts ≈ 17,060 BTU/h.

faqs.question: How do I interpret AC unit specifications?
faqs.answer: AC rated in BTU/h (cooling capacity) and watts (power consumption). Higher BTU/h = greater cooling.

faqs.question: What's the relationship between heating and cooling?
faqs.answer: Heat pump: same system heats/cools. Furnace+AC: separate heating and cooling systems.

faqs.question: How much does running AC cost?
Why does AC consume more power than heating?
faqs.answer: AC compressor is energy-intensive. Heat pumps are more efficient than resistance heating.

faqs.question: What is peak demand?
faqs.answer: Maximum power usage at any instant. Utilities may charge more for peak demand.

faqs.question: Can solar panels power my AC?
faqs.answer: Possible with enough panels. 5kW AC needs ~15-20kW solar system (accounting for efficiency).

faqs.question: What's an inverter and do I need one?
faqs.answer: Converts DC power to AC. Needed if using batteries/solar. Standard grid: not needed.

faqs.question: How do I reduce HVAC energy use?
faqs.answer: Programmable thermostat, proper insulation, regular maintenance, Energy Star equipment.
